item.title: My foray into Btrfs
item.description: My foray into Btrfs Why? Fedora uses it as default for its Workstation install and I wanted to try it for a while as the snapshotting and bitrot-detection seemed interesting for me for a while. There seem to be some benefits to be gained from reinstalling my OS on Btrfs. This blog is meant to document my learning. What is Btrfs, really? According to the Btrfs-Wiki: Btrfs is a modern copy on write (CoW) filesystem for Linux aimed at implementing advanced features while also focusing on fault tolerance, repair and easy administration.
